TopicTitle: How to find out your reputation

Articles.Content: I always wondered, how big my reputation is. Is there a way to show that value beside the loading screen? That little scale in space center view isn't very helpful at all. Funds and science points are represented as numbers, but why not reputation?

Just hit "load save" in the escape menu. Each save has its relevant info. Name, time and date, funds, science, and reputation. It's the easiest way I know to see an actual number.

Flights and contracts, too.

Edited April 15, 2017 by Cpt Kerbalkrunch

The little scale in space center view is your reputation divided by 10, but it is hard to read precisely.

The other way to get the exact value is to launch a pod to the launchpad with a crewmember in it, and then recover it. In the mission recovery dialog, on the "Crew" tab, at the bottom, it displays your precise reputation.

Another possibility: enter the Administration Building and try to enact a strategy that has a reputation setup cost. Increase the slider until the cost becomes greater than what you have, at which point it will turn red.
